data.title: Absolutely love this place.
data.text: Great choices, fun preparation and everyone can find something to their liking.  Also, the price is good for the quality of the food choices.

data.title: Must Go
data.text: I try to make it here at least once a month. I've brought every person I know here that I can to see if they like it. Not everyone has but then I question our friendship lol.

data.title: excellent stirfry
data.text: Build your own stirfry from frozen ingredients and then watch as they fry it up on a giant wok.  Delicious food and all you can eat.

data.title: Good, but it's kind of a repeat.
data.text: A buffet is great, but you are somewhat limited on what you can get cooked up. You pick your meat, veggies, noodles, then your flavoring. The first plate was great! The 2nd plate was similar to the 2nd plate. The 3rd plate wasn't as good as the first plate. The food was great...for the first plate, but it just repeated itself. Plus, the food was all frozen and wasn't very fresh. Might go back, but not for dinner...for lunch.

data.title: Okay food
data.text: Unlike the majority of my greater Minneapolis friends I am not going to rave about this place. But first things first. I like the fact that you can pick your own ingredients for your stir-fry. The restaurant has a huge buffet set up and you just fill your bowl with whatever meat, fish, seafood, vegetable and condiments/sauces you like. Then you walk up to the counter, hand your bowl to one of the chefs and watch them stir-fry for you on their huge hot stone (about the size of a millstone). It's ready within a minute or two. It's quite something and I am sure kids love to watch the cooking as much as adults do. It was my first time there so I didn't get the composition of garlic, ginger, soy sauce, etc. right...which was a bit frustrating. Also, the place looked worn (carpets, walls, tables, etc.) which gave it a cheap look and feel. However, the staff were very friendly, welcoming and attentive. Once we had finished dinner the waiter came around with a load of complimentary sweet Chinese buns. Yum!

data.title: My daughter's Favorite Place
data.text: Kahn's has great variety that you get to choose your meal from. The chef's are nice but you may have to remind them to put the optional peanuts in even if you asked for it. Staff clean up after people pretty readily. The flow at this location is awesome. Follow the seasoning guidelines, or ask from a readily available staff member. The moon bread is awesome and comes with a dinner buffet. Prices are a bit high, but you can get a lot of food too. Cons: little on the shabby side and I really wish we could get a doggy bag.

data.title: FANTASTIC FOOD
data.text: I dine-in at Khans all the time. I've introduced so many people to this restaurant - everyone says it's their favorite place to eat whenever they're in town. The place needs some updating (i.e., carpet, walls, booths, chairs, ceiling, etc...it's very dark - it needs to be brightened-up.) But everything seems to be very clean. But I don't go there because of the building - I go there for the food - it's simply amazing! Try it once; and you'll be hooked! I love to hit the gong after I've tipped the guys making the food. Everyone seems to be very friendly. I do wish the broccoli was trimmed of the excess stubs and whatnot, but that's so minor. I still love this place and will keep coming back with family and friends!

data.title: Festive fun with the Kids
data.text: This is one of my son's favorite places to dine.  We can smell the cooking way over to our house a mile away.....so we go there often.  As soon as we walk in the door, we all feel like we are somewhere away from our familiar dining spots.  The interior is very oriental, the staff play up their roles and even Japanese TV shows are broadcast.  I enjoy picking up whatever I want for the Mongolian BBQ....and along with comes appetizer soup and fried wonton strips.   We usually walk over, so that we can walk it off going back home.

data.title: Yummy!
data.text: The food is good.  Services could be a little better. Went there for lunch with my husband and it wasnt busy at all, yet the waitress hardly came over to check on us. Never got offered a refree on my pop. One thing that is a must is....order the sticky buns! Yum yum!

data.title: It's Ok
data.text: I was just at Khan's again a month ago and really realized that you don't get a lot for what you are paying.  The food is OK, but the meat was overcooked significantly and tastes a bit like cardboard :(  They used to serve the soft rolls with honey in them and have gotten rid of that now as well.  Definitely not the first place I would choose.

data.title: YUM!
data.text: This is the 2nd time I have been to a Mongolian bbq.  Khan's was great!  The food was really fresh and I was happy to be able to make mine pretty healthy.  Lots of fresh veggies!  And ohhhh.... those sweet bread thingies (don't remember what they are called) that you are given for dessert with the sticky glaze in the center are awesome!!

data.title: fresh
data.text: The ingredients used to create a stir-fry are fresh, and flavorful.  I usually do not like beef in my stir-fries because it does not taste like acceptable quality.  I ate all my beef!  I had a staff member make my sauce because I was not sure how to create it.  They are happy to assist you.  I will continue to come back for customized stir-fries made to order.  Once during the week they have a special on one bowl of stir-fry. One bowl is a lot of ingredients and noodles.  They provide a bowl of fried wonton chips, cabbage salad and rice at the table at no extra charge.

data.title: " RIP OFF ".....................
data.text: Okay, i just quite dont understand the "rules" of this establishment... First, you go in and are seated. An appetizer is served to you, without even ordering it, and you get 1 chicken wing, a STALE wonton with absolutly NO filling, and some GREASY won ton soup, which is COMPLETLY bland. And by the way, its $3.25 per appetizer.... NEXT, you get to go through the buffet " ONE" time for $10 bucks, yes... One time "buffet"???? NOT. And the funniest thing of all, after going through the buffet ONE time... YOU CANNOT BRING HOME WHATS LEFT ON YOUR PLATE... Now, i'd completly understand if this was an all you can eat buffet, therefore doggie bags would not be an option, BUT if customers are able to go through the line ONLY ONE TIME, why is it we could not have the option of bringing home what is left on our plate.... Obviously they would rather throw it away..... Thumbs DOWN to this joint!!!

data.title: My Favorite Place to eat out!
data.text: I could eat here every weekend. Great food, great atmosphere. I go here every year for my bday and I will continue to do so.

data.title: Great Food and Fun !
data.text: Been here twice and will continue to go! Love the place! Love the Food!

data.title: I like Mongolian BBQ joints, and I think this is a pretty good one.  You get a lot of food for your money, and the...
data.text: I like Mongolian BBQ joints, and I think this is a pretty good one.  You get a lot of food for your money, and the offerings are limited only by your creativity.
